alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 3:58PM EDT until August 07 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... West central Frederick County in northwestern Virginia... East central Hampshire County in eastern West Virginia... * Until 445 PM EDT. * At 358 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 12 miles northwest of Winchester, moving northeast at 50 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR EASTERN HAMPSHIRE AND WESTERN FREDERICK COUNTIES. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable damage to trees and power lines. Your life is at significant risk if outdoors. In addition to some trees falling into homes, wind damage is possible to roofs, sheds, open garages, and mobile homes. * Locations impacted include... Gore, Rock Enon Springs and High View. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern Virginia...and eastern West Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
